title: Former Tottenham boss Tim Sherwood slammed for joke about Hugo Lloris injury

Former Tottenham boss Tim Sherwood has been slammed by fans after making a joke about the horrific arm injury suffered by Hugo Lloris.

The Spurs stopper suffered a gruesome dislocated elbow in just the second minute of their 3-0 defeat to Brighton .

He was left screaming in agony as Neal Maupay tapped in the opener, being stretchered off and rushed to hospital requiring oxygen on the pitch and extra morphine in the tunnel for the pain.

But it did not stop Sherwood twisting the knife and making a brutal dig minutes after full-time as he covered the game for the Premier League channel.

Whilst analysing the opening goal, Sherwood said: "Listen, Hugo would hold his arms up if he could hold both up and say that, ‘that’s a mistake’."

(Image: Twitter)

Fellow pundit Michael Owen and presenter Manish Bhasin responded to his attempted joke with a blank response - and fans were quick to criticise the ex-Spurs and Aston Villa manager.

One fan branded the joke "gross" and questioned his status as a "club legend" for mocking their current captain.

Another simply said: "Tim Sherwood being Tim Sherwood, mocking Hugo Lloris’ injury against Brighton".

(Image: Twitter)

Lloris is facing a spell on the sidelines after his injury was confirmed.

X-rays revealed no break to the bone, which means he could be sidelined for around two months rather than longer as was initially feared.

Spurs manager Mauricio Pochettino claimed following the game that Lloris' injury had a damaging impact on the team's performance.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

He said: "He's in the hospital now but no news at the moment. We need to wait to communicate because I think he has suffered a big problem with his arm.

"It was a massive impact. I think it was after three minutes and we never recovered after that massive impact.

"It was a massive, massive emotional impact for the team. To concede and to lose a very important player for us.

"And after the first action for our new keeper after 30 minutes we concede 2-0 down. We tried to find a solution and a different way to play and it was impossible and of course a tough moment. But we need to keep going."
description: Tim Sherwood has been criticised for his brutal joke about Huge Lloris after the Tottenham goalkeeper suffered a gruesome injury
